rComments: This was a very tough class. Her reader was extremely harsh and inconsistent. If you go to her office hours and discuss your grade and your concerns she will most likely grade your work from then on. That's the problem, it makes it unfair for everybody else. If you very interested in the topic take this class, if not, don't risk it.

She was very condescending. Criticized the class' writing as a whole and always bragged about her family. Switched lecture slides very quickly which affected my note taking. TA graded every assignment very harshly even though she told us not to worry. Midterms were very easy b/c they were the same as the study guide given .

Her lectures are boring and she does not know the material. She uses power point and rushes threw them so you can not take all the notes you need. DO NOT BUY THE BOOK only the reader, bc her exams are based on lecture and only some of the legal cases in the reader. She does not know the material to answer questions. She give trick question on exam

Prof. Langridge is a good professor who is always willing to help her students. However, she moves at a fast pace, so texting/talking with a neighbor is not a good idea. The lectures are done with slides, which are brief, so pay attention when she elaborates. If you're interested in learning about the different forms of property, take this class!
Probably the worst professor of my college career.

I loved this class! I was really skeptical about it because I know NOTHING about water and not much about CA because I'm a study abroad student. It turned out to be my most favourite class. You do need to keep up with the readings but for midterms she gave out REALLY useful (ie as long as you know the stuff on the guides ull be fine)

Very knowledgable in her field which can sometimes lead to a few to many digressions. Lectures are usually very well organized if not a little long. Classes are usually note intensive also usually engaging. She is helpful and very good with her students. Great to talk to after class about current issues in environmental law.

She was very passionate about the subject, and enthusiastic. The tests are very easy if you use the study guides. She really seems to care about each student's success, and was willing to help outside of class. I had a wonderful time in her class

Sit in the front rows or your grade will drop before midterm. Can be somewhat boring but she's passionate about her subject. Says the word "story" about 300 times per class... If you are into environmental law/issues, this is probably an interesting class. Her tests are fairly easy, just do the study guide and you'll do fine.

Powerpoint lectures are filled with misspellings but she expect you to have perfectly edited papers.  Reading is dense and not interesting.  Upside is that everything is from the study guide, but dont go to her office hours to ask.  Any question you ask about the study guide pretty much means she says: you should know that already.

Very nice and willing to work with you outside of class but do not be fooled, the class claims to be both Politics and Legal Studies but it hardly a Politics class at all.  At times taught to those who had taken classes with her before leaving those who hadn't behind.  Really tough class.

If clarity were water, Ruth would be Tulare Lake -- completely dried up. She doesn't follow her syllabus in evaluating your performance and takes absences, etc. personally. If she doesn't like you will give you a bad grade despite how well you excel in the course work. Fun activity to stay awake: tally up how many times she says the word 'story'.

Worst professor I've ever had. After telling us that something was the most important thing we were going to study this quarter, she was unable to answer questions about it. Scattered lectures and powerpoints she obviously wrote either **** the previous night or dashed off in the 1/2 hour before class. Can't justify when she docks points.

Professor is unfocused, hard to follow, super-dense reading, a lot of the material seemed irrelevant to the course. Vocal pauses (uh, um, ah) every 15 seconds make it hard to take her seriously. Tests are straight from the study guide. However she changes the study guide constantly up to the night before the test. She is a sweet person regardless.

Honestly, the worst expirience ive had with a teacher.  Unorganized, unsympathetic, careless, and above all no-passion for what she is teaching.  It seems easy at first, but then she piles it on, and grades hard... DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS.

Sweet teacher, good environmental fighter, but please girl, get rid of those over-heads! My hand got arthiritis from COPYING so many notes and all the while her foggy explanations would make my head dizzy. She is really sweet though, but one word of advice, slide up your damn desk to the front of the room or the repercusions may haunt you. 5 Stars.

Classes are a bore. She makes the subject torture when it really shouldn't be. She also has no command over the classroom. Knowledge is limited to what she knows, and what she knows is limited to very few sources. Rigid explanations of the information doesn't make for a rewarding experience. Easy, but stay away if you want to enjoy the subject.

Ruth Langridge overall is not too bad of a professor. She isn’t great and she isn’t bad. For the most part she is easy but she is a stickler for editing. If you turn in any assignment with a minor error such as “I” instead of “is” (word auto corrects to the uppercase…) she will mark you down. I found that this type of nitpicking was VERY annoying e

Here's a teacher that either does not prepare for class, or needs to focus. She jumps from topic to topic and lacks cohesion in her lectures. If you do the reading, you are likely to know more about the daily topic than her! She is easy, that is why people like her, but if you are the impatient type it may be hard for you.

At times CA Water Law and Policy was extremely boring, but looking back on the class, I learned a lot!  Ruth's study guides were great!  Everything that was on the test was on the study guide, so there were absolutely no suprises.  Fairly easy class if you do the work.  My only complaint is that she took a very long time to return our work.
A very sweet lady and obviously knowledgeable, but to an extent that it makes it hard to follow. Not any clearer in OH. Do the study guides - they help a lot. Managed an A despite a lack of clarity.
Lots of good information, not always the greatest lectures.
No Comments

She is my favorite professor at UCSC. I loved both classes that I took with her. The assignments were fairly easy, just took a while to do. Awesome lecturer and very knowledgeable about the subject matter. She's passionate about what she does and knows. Highly recommended!

Boring.  If you can stay awake, its an easy class.  All you have to do in any of her classes is pick one topic, spend all your study time on it and impress her with your overwhelming knowledge of one thing.  Remember this: The public trust doctrine.  Pick

Ruth is the expert here on law relating to the envirionment. While some of her assignments may be a little tough. Her exams are easy and she is approachable. She knows what she is doing. Take her and do the work and u shall be rewarded with an A.

Needs to push students more. Class gets bored & zones out, so she asks really obvious questions to bring them back. Students think they're tricks & don't answer. Ppl less likely to take seriously. Needs to manage time better. Very nice and committed to knowing ppl's names and stuff.

Selection of readings was a bit heavy -- lots of reading in a very short time period. Time organization needs work: not enough time alloted for research paper. Extra assignments added that weren't on the syllabus. Very fair and understanding. Enthusiastic and friendly.

Ruth class is interesting to say the least. Her only negative is that she spends too much time on hypothetical situations. She also has trouble managing time in the lectures. Besides that she is very helpfull and know her stuff
Ruth is a very dedicated professor.  She believes strongly in her subject and really tries to connect with the students.  She provides study guides for tests, is helpful, but notes can get bothersome
